title: Top 20 Issues on the International Climate Change Issue Agenda according to the Web
sections:
Top 20 Issues on the International Climate Change Issue Agenda according to the Web

This graphic gives a picture of the agenda of international climate change NGOs according to their websites. Adaptation is at the top of the agenda of climate NGOs, with the vulnerability indicators ‘food’ and ‘water’ being addressed as the top two issues, followed by ‘community’ as the third.

[a]

Figure 1. Top 20 Issues on the International Climate Change Issue Agenda according to the Web. Source: EMAPS Sprint Amsterdam. Date: 24-28 March 2014.

How to read the map

This map is a list of the seventeen issues that resonate the most in the websites of the 74 climate NGOs. Issues are displayed in descending order according to the number of mentions that each issue receives in each website.

How the map is built (map building protocol)

A list of 74 NGO websites is compiled by triangulating the members of two prominent climate networks, the Climate Action Network and TCKTCKTCK. Searching manually through the NGOs’ mission and agenda pages delivered 279 issues. Their resonance is determined by querying this issue list on all 74 websites. The result is an issue agenda with  main issues, sub-issues and main actors. The seventeen twenty issues are depicted as main issues (those with a higher frequency of mentions) and the remaining 259 are considered sub-issues and clustered around the main ones.

[a]eliminate issue: climate, climate change. eliminate  women
